comments.body:
Is `ipywidgets` (or something similar) an optional runtime dependency? If so, should the version be constrained with:
```suggestion
    - python
  run_constrained:
    - ipywidgets >=X.Y
```
This means `ipywidgets` isn't a required runtime dependency, but if it is installed it has be be version X.Y or greater.

(If the version doesn't matter this can be ignored)

Yes if `atpbar` is used on jupyter notebook. In travis-ci, in python 3, `ipywidgets` and `widgetsnbextension` are automatically installed when `jupyter` is installed; however, in python 2.7, they won't be automatically installed with `jupyter`.

Personally I like including the dev and doc URLs even if they're the same:
```suggestion
    multiprocessing tasks on terminal and Jupyter Notebook.
  dev_url: https://github.com/alphatwirl/atpbar
  doc_url: https://github.com/alphatwirl/atpbar#atpbar
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +39,43 @@    atpbar can display multiple progress bars simultaneously growing
    to show the progresses of iterations of loops in threading or
    multiprocessing tasks on terminal and Jupyter Notebook.
  dev_url: https://github.com/alphatwirl/atpbar
  doc_url: https://github.com/alphatwirl/atpbar#atpbar

comments.body: According to the terms of the licence a copy of the text should be included the tarball. You can either include it in the recipe directory or make a new release having added `include LICENSE` to your `MANIFEST.in` file.

And it's passing! üéâ (you can ignore `win_64` on Azure, see #7715)

Do you want to make a new release that includes the licence file in the PyPI tarball or shall I merge?
Thank you. I inlucded `LICENSE` in the receipe direcotry. I will include it in `MANIFEST.in` for the next release.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +34,38 @@  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD

  summary: 'Progress bars for threading and multiprocessing tasks on terminal and Jupyter Notebook'
  description: |
